p: The soil biota treatment was fresh field-collected soil from each of the central, south, and north Florida sites. For the control treatment, we sterilized half of these field-collected soils from the current and new ranges. The sterile soil inoculum was autoclaved three times, and we mixed the soil in between autoclave events, to ensure sterilization of the soils. The soil biota and sterile control inocula comprised 5 % of the mass of the pot, to ensure sufficient inoculation of the soil biota to the pot while also maintaining the same nutrient conditions and soil characteristics across all treatments (as in Reinhart and Callaway 2006).
